articles.title: About this blog
articles.description: Some additional details about the blog
articles.contents:
Feeding Happy
          
          
          Home

          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            About this blog
          
          
            
              Hi there! Welcome to my blog.
              My name is Djamila and I’m currently in the final year
              of my PhD. I am investigating how diet is associated with
              mental and gastrointestinal health, and the gut microbiota
              - the ecosystem of microorganisms residing within our
              guts
              The study that I’ve been working on for the last
              several years is called Bugs
              and Brains: The Gut and Mental Health Study. It is the
              world’s first study to compare the physiological and
              microbial profiles of healthy adults to those with
              irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), anxiety and depression,
              and those with comorbid IBS and anxiety/depression
              I am passionate about all things food and how we can
              eat to feel well physically and mentally - how to feed
              (feel) happy
              Thank you for joining me on this journey! x
            
            
              Hi there! Welcome to my blog.
              My name is Djamila and I’m currently in the final year
              of my PhD. I am investigating how diet is associated with
              mental and gastrointestinal health, and the gut microbiota
              - the ecosystem of microorganisms residing within our
              guts
              The study that I’ve been working on for the last
              several years is called Bugs
              and Brains: The Gut and Mental Health Study. It is the
              world’s first study to compare the physiological and
              microbial profiles of healthy adults to those with
              irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), anxiety and depression,
              and those with comorbid IBS and anxiety/depression
              I am passionate about all things food and how we can
              eat to feel well physically and mentally - how to feed
              (feel) happy
              Thank you for joining me on this journey! x

articles.title: Published Work
articles.description: A collection of scientific publications and research reports
articles.contents:
Publications
How can we combat the obesity epidemic? (Eliby 2022)
Bugs and Brains, the Gut and Mental Health Study: a mixed-methods
study investigating microbiota composition and function in anxiety,
depression and irritable bowel syndrome (Simpson, Schwartz, et al. 2021)
Decoding explicit and implicit representations of health and
taste attributes of foods in the human brain (Schubert et al. 2021)
The gut microbiota in anxiety and depression – a systematic
review (Simpson, Diaz-Arteche, et
al. 2021)
Research Reports
The
microbiota and our mental health
How
to maintain a healthy biome in a Covid-19 world



Eliby, Djamila. 2022. “How can we combat the
obesity epidemic?” The Journal of Health Design 7
(1): 490–93. https://doi.org/10.21853/jhd.2022.156.


Schubert, Elektra, Daniel Rosenblatt, Djamila Eliby, Yoshihisa Kashima,
Hinze Hogendoorn, and Stefan Bode. 2021. “Decoding explicit and implicit representations of health
and taste attributes of foods in the human brain.”
Neuropsychologia 162. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuropsychologia.2021.108045.


Simpson, Carra A, Carmela Diaz-Arteche, Djamila Eliby, Orli S Schwartz,
Julian G Simmons, and Caitlin S M Cowan. 2021. “The gut microbiota in anxiety and depression – A
systematic review.” Clinical Psychology Review
83: 101943. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cpr.2020.101943.


Simpson, Carra A, Orli S Schwartz, Djamila Eliby, Catherine A Butler,
Bridget L Callaghan, Katherine Huang, Neil O Brien-, et al. 2021.
“Bugs and Brains, the Gut and Mental Health
Study: a mixed-methods study investigating microbiota composition and
function in anxiety , depression and irritable bowel
syndrome.” BMJ Open 11:e043221. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmjopen-2020-043221.
